items.title: Can one Tensorflow session connect to two targets at the same time?
items.body:
In Tensorflow, we could create a server using server=tf.train.Server(), and define a Tensorflow session to connect that server by sess=tf.Session(server.target). Now if we create two (or more than two) servers, can a Tensorflow session connect to both of them at the same time?

For example, we define two servers:

  • Local Server: local_server = tf.train.Server(...).create_local_server()
  • Worker Server: worker_server = tf.train.Server(cluster_spec) with cluster_spec = tf.train.ClusterSpec( {"ps": ["localhost:2222"],"worker": ["localhost:1111", "localhost:1112"]})

In the above case, is it possible to define a single Tensorflow session tf.Session() that connects to both "Local" and "Worker" servers in a single process? The goal is to make part of graph tensors compute on 1 server, and all the other part run on the other server.
